remarks: Define the function associating with a set the free real vector space on that set, equipped with the natural inner product.  This is the direct sum of copies of the field of real numbers indexed by that set.  We call it here a "generalized real Euclidean space", but note that it need not be complete (for instance if the given set is infinite countable). (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 16-Jun-2019.)
